issue.title: web.gekisaka.jp
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://web.gekisaka.jp/news/jryouth/detail/?398699-398699-fl=](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fweb.gekisaka.jp%2Fnews%2Fjryouth%2Fdetail%2F%3F398699-398699-fl%3D) ### Comment > This cannot be reproduced on a Windows Chrome. I tried changing the user agent but still could not reproduce. However, it can be reproduced on an iPhone. Additionally, there is no rule within the existing Japanese filters to hide the class named SP_NEWS_D_SP_ONLY ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/d1jp4eibnvcckcs8wo8cgwgokc8k0ow8c0bj5ux5sg.jpg?nc=1)

comment.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://web.gekisaka.jp/news/domestic/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fweb.gekisaka.jp%2Fnews%2Fdomestic%2F) ### Comment > The frame of this advertisement cannot be reproduced on my PC. It appears on my iPhone. I'm aware that there is a rule in the Japanese filter to hide the class PC_SP_NEWS_D_GROUP , but the rule doesn't seem to be effective. I've tried restarting the device, updating the filter (waiting for 5 minutes), clearing Safari's cache, toggling advanced protection on and off (waiting for 5 minutes), but the issue persists. Do you have any insights into why this might be happening?? ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/kl43u9bxxxc084wcsgsock8gsgg8kc4ghe9gdxpwi0.jpg?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for iOS v4.5.3 DNS filtering: | server: `https://doh.quad9.net/dns-query`
